I crept closer, my bare feet silent on the carpet, and with a swift motion, I pushed it. The clock groaned, its bell tolling once, twice, before Dad's voice boomed from the kitchen, "What the—?" Perfect. I took my chance, dashing into my room and throwing on some clothes. By the time Dad came storming up the stairs, I was sitting at my desk, a textbook open in front of me, the picture of innocence. "Everything okay, Dad?" I asked, feigning ignorance. He eyed me suspiciously but eventually shrugged it off. "Yeah, just the clock acting up again," he grumbled, returning to his culinary duties. I exhaled, relief washing over me. Another crisis averted, thanks to a bit of quick thinking and a noisy old clock.
